Chose.definition: a piece of personal property chose in action
Chose.origin: [Anglo-French, literally, thing, from Old French, from Latin causa legal case, reason, cause]

chose in action.definition: a right to something (as payment of a debt or damages for injury) that can be recovered in a lawsuita document (as a check or stock certificate) embodying such a right

chose in possession.definition: something that is in one's actual possession or can be possessed
